thread.title: 5 Vintage-Inspired Screens to Add a Touch of Gucci’s Runway Magic to Your Home
thread.title_full: 5 Vintage-Inspired Screens to Add a Touch of Gucci’s Runway Magic to Your Home - Vogue

author: Brooke Bobb
title: 5 Vintage-Inspired Screens to Add a Touch of Gucci’s Runway Magic to Your Home
text:
As expected, the Gucci Spring 2016 collection was everything. There was Lurex knitwear and zipped-up lace, a fury of quirky prints, smartly appointed touches of the house’s signature red-and-green stripe, as well as sequins and candy-color chiffon. And Alessandro Michele ’ s grandma-meets-hipster-geek-meets-bohemian-chic show was made even better by the matching decor. He outfitted the Scalo Farini, an old abandoned train station, with folding screens covered in Gucci patterns of the season, bamboo-back chairs upholstered in the same jewel print from the collection, and a giant carpet woven with a floral print and pink snakes throughout. Michele surely knows how to make covetable clothes that excite and entice, but he also has a keen eye for interiors that shouldn’t be overshadowed. The Gucci world is now one we don’t just want to dress in, it’s quickly becoming one we want to actually live in.
Inspired by the retro room dividers that punctuated the runway yesterday, here are five folding screens to add a touch of that multiform Gucci cool to the home.
